text: The Republican Party of National Reconstitution (, PRRN), commonly known as the Reconstitution Party, was a political party in Portugal ==History== The PRRN was established in 1920 as a right-wing breakaway from the Democratic Party.Dieter Nohlen & Philip Stöver (2010) Elections in Europe: A data handbook, p1554 The new party emerged as the third-largest in the 1921 elections, winning 12 of the 163 seats in the House of Representatives and 7 of the 71 seats in the Senate. The 1922 elections saw the party win 17 House seats and 10 Senate seats. In 1923 the PRRN merged with the Republican Liberal Party and the National Republican Party to form the Nationalist Republican Party. ==References== Category:Defunct political parties in Portugal Category:Political parties established in 1920 Category:Political parties disestablished in 1923 Category:1920 establishments in Portugal Category:1923 disestablishments in Portugal
title: Reconstitution Party
